answers.answer: Hi.Is your blood pressure adequately controlled? Are these symptoms present when your blood pressure is abnormal?The symptoms you are experiencing might likely be more related to nerve compression, possibly a carpal tunnel syndrome.If you are concerned about this, you can opt to consult a neurologist.Hope this helps.

Hi Pinky,How are you feeling now?Any type of tingling, burning, or numbness is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured. The nerve involved nerves appears to originate from Brachial plexus. Any infection at the root of nerve or compression will cause similar lesion.This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, vitamin deficiency, altered blood pressure status or any nutritional deficiency.I think you should consult physician and if required neurologist.Bye.

question: I am only 25 but i have had issues with my blood pressure since i was 17 when i had my son. For the last week a little over my left hand has been tingleing more so my baby finger but it is starting to go into  the rest of my fingers and slowly up my arm . I feel fine other wise but i am worried this is something to do with my blood pressure again . do you think this is serious?
title: tingleing in my hand
